name: Toronto Trivia Night
description:
Combine your love of trivia with the opportunity to help Canadians affected by cancer! 

By registering your team of up to 10 players, you get to participate in an evening of friendly competition and seriously cool fundraising. 

You will make a difference for the nearly half of Canadians expected to be diagnosed with cancer in their lifetime by funding life-saving cancer research to better detect, treat and prevent cancer. You will also enable our nationwide support system, so all Canadians affected by cancer have access to trusted information and compassionate support at every stage of their journey. 

The future of cancer is in your hands. Play trivia. Raise funds. Change lives.

name: Beginner Winter Tree Tour at Falstaff Park
description:
Join us for a beginner-friendly winter tour at Falstaff Park, focused on the basics of identifying trees in winter. We'll explore features like bark, branch pattern, and overall shape, helping you build confidence in winter ID. You'll also learn how these trees fit into the broader ecology of Toronto's urban forest. This relaxed walk is perfect for anyone new to tree identification or curious about how much the winter landscape can reveal once you know what to look for.
 
This tour will have both inside and outside components. Dress according to the weather to stay warm and prepare for uneven and slippery terrain. Tour distances will range from 1â€“ 5 km.
 
Space is limited. Please register in advance at greentoronto@toronto.ca. Include the name of the tour you would like to attend and the number of attendees.
 
Contact greentoronto@toronto.ca for information on site conditions, and accessibility. If you would like to request accessibility support, contact us as soon as possible.
